intro: Calceolaria pachycyta, commonly known as the thick-leaved slipper orchid, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Andes Mountains of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, slipper-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
